by Skial Bainn published on Thursday 29th May 2014

# Haxe Roundup № 179

As it's getting closer to Christmas, let's start with the Top 10 Haxe Christmas Carols by Allan Dowdeswell.

Shelter Belt Design Tool is Allan's summer project using Haxe and OpenLayers for the Government of Canada.

Andreas Rønning has written a brilliant post titled Let's clarity Haxe and OpenFL. A must read.

The OpenFL have released OpenFL v1.2 complete with Tizen support, audio fixes and more improvements!

And to go with the new OpenFL Tizen target, OpenFL are in partnership with Tizen. The partnership makes the SWF library free to all developers and financial incentives.

The Lime framework has also gotten a new logo on it's website.

Joshua Granick has put out a tweet asking for part-time help to build a Neko web service or native extensions. Get in contact with him if your interested.

Elliott Stoneham has written a follow-up post to his golang->ssa->haxe slides.

Andy Li has successfully gotten TravisCI to test all 10 Haxe targets!

Last week, David Peek showed the Haxe compiler running on Android. He has posted a gist for anyone wanting to following in his foot steps.
